### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16489](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16489.html) (log: harmonize bitcoind logging by jonatack)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

> I suggest changing the default value to: `false`.
> 
> As it opens an attack vector to stop all core nodes remotely and additionally previously none of the users would expect that remote servers could stop their nodes.

@marpme that would be a breaking change. You should always restrict RPC access anyway.

Maybe support any RPC, like `-rpcrestrict=sendtoaddress,sendmany,stop`?

Edit: 👇
#12763 is a more general solution

@marpme 
I'm skeptical about this. Maybe some people are relying on a remote stop. I think your suggestion could be added later if the PR gets into the code
Yeah, concept NACK on something this specific.

Tend towards concept NACK, seems awfully specific. I'd prefer like to avoid wild growth of features such as this.

Bitcoin core RPC is *not* safe for use remotely in any case, definitely not with untrusted users. Blocking one "attack vector" leaves tons of DoS and potential other vulnerabilities.

I guess the use case for this is to have some kind of public RPC query service? If so, the common suggestion is to use a proxy that filters what commands are allowed to be used and passes only those on.
(alternatively, doesn't REST provide the needed queries? this could avoid messing with authentication completely)
Ok I will close this now because of all the arguments above especially that it is too specific, feel free to steal if you need this in future :)
Could you follow [Coding Style (C++)](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/developer-notes.md#coding-style-c)?
This block is redundant with the one at L174 and could be extracted.
Suggest: "Accept shutdown (stop) commands from remote RPC clients."
I also thought about this but I want that it is clear that it is referring to the "stop" command.

Are you sure about this?
This block should only be executed if remote stop is disabled so a separate string slicing even if it isn't necessary is a bit too much overhead imo.
Sure thing
Done

> You can use the provided [clang-format-diff script](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/contrib/devtools/README.md#clang-format-diffpy) tool to clean up patches automatically before submission.
Just `StartRPC(gArgs.GetBoolArg("-rpcallowstop", true));` ?
Yes, I was orienting myself at the code below
Fixed
